DOTORI MUK

Korean dotori muk is a type of jelly made from acorns. It is often eaten as a dessert or snack, and can be found in many Korean grocery stores.

4-6 servings 35 minutes
THIS IS AN ADVERT

Equipment

  • A pot
  • A strainer
  • A spoon

Ingredients

  • Acorns
  • Water
  • Sugar
  • Pine nuts (optional)

Directions

  1. Soak acorns in water overnight.
  2. Drain acorns and remove any shells or skins.
  3. Boil acorns in water for 30 minutes.
  4. Add sugar and pine nuts (optional) and boil for an additional 5 minutes.
  5. Remove from heat and let cool.
  6. Serve dotori muk cold or at room temperature.
